newsitem.title: USA: PRESS DIGEST - Washington Post page one - Dec 30.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Washington Post page one - Dec 30.

text.p: The Washington Post carried the following stories on its front page on December 30:

WASHINGTON - The senior Democrat on the House Ethics Committee joined other members of his party in throwing a major roadblock in the way of Republican hopes of resolving the ethics case of Speaker Newt Gingrich by early next week.
GUATEMALA CITY - Guatemalan President Alvaro Arzu and leftist rebel leaders signed a final peace agreement ending Central America's last and longest civil war.

WASHINGTON - For years, corporate law offices have been known by many in the profession as sweatshops where young lawyers toil in dreary obscurity, but now firms are improving their treatment in a bid to cut defections.

TOKYO - North Korea issued an extraordinary apology for sending commandos on a spy submarine into South Korean waters in September, instantly easing months of high-stakes tension on the Korean Peninsula.
WASHINGTON - Developing countries used to seek aid from foreign governments and international lending institutions, but now they are more likely to court foreign companies to invest in their markets.
